definitions.definition: something, especially money, that somebody gives you because they have hurt you, or damaged something that you own; the act of giving this to somebody

examples.text: The employer has a duty to pay full compensation for injuries received at work.
She received a cash sum by way of compensation.
He got some compensation for damages.
She received £7 000 as compensation for her injuries.
The money was small compensation for unfair dismissal.
They will have to pay £5 000 in compensation.
the rules used for determining compensation
Compensation has cost the company a lot of money.
He has made a compensation claim to an industrial tribunal.
The businesses that had to relocate received £10 000 each in compensation from the local council.
The court awarded her compensation of £58 000 for unfair dismissal.

definitions.definition: money that an employee receives for doing their job

examples.text: Send your CV and current compensation to Executive Search Consultant.

definitions.definition: a thing or things that make a bad situation better

examples.text: I wish I were young again, but getting older has its compensations.
The grey streets of London were small compensation for the loss of her beloved Africa.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: via Old French from Latin compensatio(n-), from the verb compensare ‘weigh against’, from com- ‘together’ + pensare (frequentative of pendere ‘weigh’).
